zip_zap_zop.name: Zip Zap Zop
zip_zap_zop.description: A high-energy focus game that builds group connection, eye contact, and present-moment awareness. Great for syncing the group and shaking off mental clutter.
zip_zap_zop.howToPlay: Stand in a circle. One person points to another and says 'Zip'. That person immediately points to someone else and says 'Zap'. They then point to another and say 'Zop'. The pattern repeats in order: Zip → Zap → Zop.
variations: Add full-body gestures for each word
Add a fourth word to disrupt the pattern
tips: Make strong eye contact before passing
Mistakes are part of the fun

bunny_bunny.name: Bunny Bunny
bunny_bunny.description: A high-energy multi-tasking game with three simultaneous activities that builds focus, coordination, and group awareness.
bunny_bunny.howToPlay: Stand in a circle. One student passes 'Bunny Bunny' to another while flanking students respond with 'Tookie Tookie'. The rest of the group chants 'Ooh-Ah' while making running motions. Speed increases progressively.
tips: Don't let mistakes break your focus
Support the whole group, not just yourself

bippity_bippity_bop.name: Bippity Bippity Bop
bippity_bippity_bop.description: A focus and reaction game where one player in the center calls commands that require specific responses from circle players.
bippity_bippity_bop.howToPlay: One student in the center points at circle players and calls commands like 'Bop', 'Biddie Biddie Bop', 'Elephant', etc. Players must respond with the correct gesture or movement. Mistakes send you to the center.

what_are_you_doing.name: What Are You Doing?
what_are_you_doing.description: A justification game where players mime one action while verbally describing a completely different activity.
what_are_you_doing.howToPlay: Two students alternate. One mimes an activity while the other asks 'What are you doing?' The first responds with a different activity, which the second must then mime while being asked the same question. Continue trading off.
tips: Don't match your words to your actions

mirror_exercise.name: Mirror Exercise
mirror_exercise.description: A partner exercise that builds nonverbal listening, empathy, and physical connection through shared movement.
mirror_exercise.howToPlay: Partner up and face each other. One person leads slow, continuous movements while the other mirrors exactly. Switch roles, then try moving together without assigning a leader.
tips: Move slowly enough to be mirrored

pass_the_character.name: Pass the Character
pass_the_character.description: A transformation game that practices character observation, replication, and physical commitment.
pass_the_character.howToPlay: One student makes eye contact across the circle and walks toward another while embodying a character. The second student replicates everything observed before approaching a different participant with the same or evolved character.

zombie.name: Zombie
zombie.description: A high-energy physical game where players transform from humans to zombies through tagging.
zombie.howToPlay: One designated zombie moves slowly to tag humans, converting them. Tagged students transform before pursuing others. The game concludes when everyone becomes a zombie.

crazy_eights.name: Crazy Eights
crazy_eights.description: A full-body counting exercise that releases tension and builds group energy through rhythmic movement.
crazy_eights.howToPlay: Standing in a circle, shake each limb while counting to eight, maintaining eye contact. Repeat the pattern with descending numbers (7, 6, 5...) until reaching one.

emotional_zip_zap_zop.name: Emotional Zip Zap Zop
emotional_zip_zap_zop.description: A vocal variation of Zip Zap Zop that adds emotional commitment and vocal variety to the classic game.
emotional_zip_zap_zop.howToPlay: Pass 'Zip', 'Zap', and 'Zop' around a circle using a chosen emotion. Energy escalates with each round, intensifying vocal and physical expressions.
tips: Let emotion affect your whole body

sound_ball.name: Sound Ball
sound_ball.description: A vocal and physical warm-up that encourages play, commitment, and vocal variety without relying on language.
sound_ball.howToPlay: Stand in a circle. Make a sound and physically 'throw' it to someone. They catch it, transform the sound, and throw a new sound to someone else.

gibberish.name: Gibberish
gibberish.description: An exercise that removes the pressure of words, encouraging emotional clarity, physicality, and truthful reactions.
gibberish.howToPlay: Have a scene or conversation using only made-up sounds. Communicate through tone, rhythm, and physical behavior.

tongue_twisters.name: Tongue Twisters
tongue_twisters.description: A classic articulation warm-up that prepares the voice for clarity, precision, and speed.
tongue_twisters.howToPlay: Repeat tongue twisters slowly and clearly, then gradually increase speed while maintaining articulation.

energy_circle.name: Energy Circle
energy_circle.description: A sound and movement exercise where energy builds and heightens as it passes around the group.
energy_circle.howToPlay: One student initiates a simple action and sound. The circle mimics it, with energy heightening noticeably as it passes around. Volume alone doesn't constitute proper heightening.

mind_meld.name: Mind Meld
mind_meld.description: A group association game that builds collective thinking and ensemble connection by finding shared ideas.
mind_meld.howToPlay: Two people say a word at the same time. If they match, celebrate. If not, each person says a new word inspired by both previous words. Repeat until the words match.

word_association.name: Word Association
word_association.description: A fast-paced association game that trains instinctive responses and quieting the inner editor.
word_association.howToPlay: Stand in a circle. One person says a word. The next immediately responds with the first word that comes to mind.

category_mix.name: Category Mix
category_mix.description: A quick-thinking game where players rapidly list items in a category while maintaining focus and momentum.
category_mix.howToPlay: Students raise hands and list items in a chosen category while pointing to the next participant. Players continue the pattern, making eye contact and avoiding anticipation.

five_things.name: Five Things
five_things.description: A rapid-fire listing game that trains quick thinking and overcoming mental blocks.
five_things.howToPlay: Taking turns, students list five items found in suggested locations. The class counts aloud after each item. Pausing isn't permitted, and 'people' doesn't qualify as a specific answer.

object_work.name: Object Work
object_work.description: A realism exercise that strengthens physical specificity and believability in scenes.
object_work.howToPlay: Mime everyday tasks using invisible objects, focusing on weight, resistance, size, and texture.
tips: Let the object affect your body

status_exercise.name: Status Exercise
status_exercise.description: An exploration of how status affects behavior, relationships, and storytelling on stage.
status_exercise.howToPlay: Assign each person a status number from 1 (low) to 10 (high). Interact based on that status using posture, eye contact, and space.
tips: Status can change moment to moment

i_am_a_tree.name: I Am a Tree
i_am_a_tree.description: A classic environment-building exercise that practices object work, justification, and group awareness.
i_am_a_tree.howToPlay: Students enter the center sequentially, each declaring a role that supports previous roles. After three participants, the first removes one person, restarting the pattern with those remaining.

hot_spot.name: Hot Spot
hot_spot.description: A song-based warm-up where players tag in and out, singing established songs inspired by previous lyrics.
hot_spot.howToPlay: A word inspiration prompts students to run to center stage and sing established songs. Performers tag out successively, with each new song inspired by the previous one.

splat.name: Splat
splat.description: A high-energy elimination game that builds quick reactions and competitive playfulness.
splat.howToPlay: The instructor points at circle participants, prompting them to duck while flanking students shoot finger-guns at each other. The quickest shooter wins; eliminated students sit down until two remain for the finale.

look_and_scream.name: Look and Scream
look_and_scream.description: A fast-paced elimination game building awareness, eye contact, and playful tension release.
look_and_scream.howToPlay: Heads down initially, students raise their heads on command. Those making eye contact scream and exit. The circle contracts after each elimination until two remain for the final round.

yes_and_circle.name: Yes And Circle
yes_and_circle.description: A foundational acceptance exercise that reinforces the core improv principle of saying yes and building on ideas without judgment.
yes_and_circle.howToPlay: Stand in a circle. One person makes a statement. The next responds with 'Yes, and…' and adds new information. Continue around the circle, always accepting and expanding.
variations: Add a physical action with each line
tips: Let go of trying to be clever

zoom_schwartz_profigliano.name: Zoom Schwartz Profigliano
zoom_schwartz_profigliano.description: A focus and pattern game with three moves that builds concentration and group awareness.
zoom_schwartz_profigliano.howToPlay: Students pass an imaginary 'ball' using three moves: Zoom (any direction), Schwartz (backward), and Profigliano (left/right). Consecutive identical moves break the sequence.

electric_company.name: Electric Company
electric_company.description: A word-building game that creates compound words while maintaining group rhythm and celebration.
electric_company.howToPlay: The group creates compound words in sequence. After completing a word pair, everyone chants 'Mah Na Mah Na' before moving to the next combination.

big_booty.name: Big Booty
big_booty.description: A rhythm and call-and-response game that builds focus, listening, and group energy through playful pressure.
big_booty.howToPlay: Stand in a circle and assign each person a number. Establish a rhythm (slap thighs twice, clap twice). Leader says 'Big Booty' three times, then calls a number. That number responds with their number twice and calls a new number, staying in rhythm.
tips: Protect the rhythm at all costs
